Type.Name: ListStore

TypeSignature.Value: public class ListStore : GLib.Object, Gtk.TreeDragDest, Gtk.TreeDragSource, Gtk.TreeModel, Gtk.TreeSortable, System.Collections.IEnumerable

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: The ListStore is a columned list data structure to be used with widget.

remarks.para: Iteration: In new versions of Gtk# (2.0 and up) this class implements the interface, so code can be written like this:

Docs.summary: Returns the number of children that has.
Docs.returns: an object of type , the number of children of .
Docs.remarks: As a special case, if is , then the number of toplevel nodes is returned.

Docs.summary: Sets to point to the first child of .
Docs.returns: an object of type , , if has been set to the first child.

remarks.para: If has no children, is returned and is set to be invalid. will remain a valid node after this function has been called.
If is returns the first node, equivalent to gtk_tree_model_get_iter_first (tree_model, iter);

Docs.summary: Emits a event.

Docs.summary: Sets the column number to sort by.
Docs.param: A , the column number to sort by.

Docs.summary: Sets a sort function to be used for the column .
Docs.remarks: This overload is obsolete. The two parameter overload is preferred for new code.

Docs.summary: Set the function that will be used by default to sort columns.

Docs.summary: The function that will be used by default to sort columns.

Docs.summary: Returns true if the row at can have dropped on it.
Docs.returns: A boolean.

Docs.summary: Drags data received into this object.
Docs.param: A , the destination path of the drag
A , the data that was dragged
Docs.returns: A boolean, true if the data was successfully received.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool DragDataGet (Gtk.TreePath path, Gtk.SelectionData selection_data);

Docs.summary: Method used when this ListStore is part of a source widget for a drag-and-drop operation; gets the data that was dragged from the associated widget.
Docs.returns: A , true if the operation succeeded.

Docs.summary: Returns whether or not a given row can be dragged.
Docs.returns: A boolean, true if the row is draggable.

Docs.summary: When this ListStore is the data source for a drag operation and the drag operation is a move, this method runs to delete the data after the data has been received by the target widget.
Docs.param: A , the path of the data to delete.
Docs.returns: A , true if the operation succeeds.

MemberSignature.Value: public void EmitRowChanged (Gtk.TreePath path, Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Fires a event. Call this after changing a row so that the view widget for this ListStore will update.
Runs a method on every row of a ListStore.
Docs.param: A to run over every row.

Docs.summary: Initializes with the first iterator in the ListStore (the top item).
Docs.returns: A , true if the operation is successful, false if the ListStore is empty.

MemberSignature.Value: public void EmitRowHasChildToggled (Gtk.TreePath path, Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Emits a event. This is meant to be called whenever the child state of a node changes.
Docs.param: a to pass to the event
a to pass to the event
Docs.remarks: This is mandated by the , but it shouldn't get used much for ListStores because they don't generally have child nodes.

Docs.summary: Turns a specified by into a .
Docs.returns: a

Docs.summary: Tests whether a given row has a child node.
Docs.returns: A , always false for ListStores.
Docs.remarks: This is mandated by

Docs.summary: Lets the ListStore reference the row pointed to by .

remarks.para: This function is primarily meant as a way for views to let caching model know when nodes are being displayed (and hence, whether or not to cache that node.) For example, a file-system based model would not want to keep the entire file-hierarchy in memory, just the sections that are currently being displayed by every current view.
A model should be expected to be able to get an iter independent of its reffed state.

Docs.summary: Returns the number of children that has. If is null, as in the case of all ListStore objects, this will return the number of top-level items.
Docs.returns: a
Docs.remarks: FIXME: Why does ListStore.custom call gtk_tree_model_iter_n_children?

MemberSignature.Value: public void EmitRowInserted (Gtk.TreePath path, Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Fires a event.
Docs.param: a to pass to the event.
a see cref="T:Gtk.TreeIter" /> to pass to the event.

Docs.summary: Fires a event.
Docs.param: a to pass to the event.

MemberSignature.Value: public void GetValist (Gtk.TreeIter iter, IntPtr var_args);

Docs.summary: Gets the values of child properties for the row pointed to by .
Docs.param: a , pointer to the va_list data structure of arguments (FIXME: clarify what va_lists look like)

Docs.summary: Lets the ListStore unref the row at .

remarks.para: This is an optional method for models to implement. To be more specific, models may ignore this call as it exists primarily for performance reasons.
For more information on what this means, see . Please note that nodes that are deleted are not unreffed.

Docs.summary: Removes all data from the store.

Docs.summary: Sets the values of child properties for the row pointed to by .

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetValue (Gtk.TreeIter iter, int column, GLib.Value value);

Docs.summary: Sets the value of the specified column in the row pointed by .
Docs.remarks: The type of specified column must be a .

Docs.summary: Internal constructor

remarks.para: This is an internal constructor, and should not be used by user code.

Docs.summary: The number of columns in this ListStore.
The flags for this ListStore.
Docs.remarks: Flags are about the shape of this object's data; see the class documentation for more details.

Docs.summary: Raised when the sorting column has changed.
Raised when the display of a given row's children is toggled.
Raised when a row of data is inserted.
Raised when a row is deleted.
Raised when a row has changed.
Raised when the order of rows has changed.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IterNthChild (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, int n);

Docs.summary: Sets to be the child of this ListStore, using the given index. The first index is 0. If is too big, or this ListStore has no rows, is set to an invalid iterator and false is returned. For ListStore objects, the th root node is set, since they don't have a tree-like structure.
Docs.returns: a , true if has an th child.
Docs.remarks: This is a custom binding for Gtk# which assumes that the current object is the parent. An alternate invocation form that parallels the C API is available.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IterNthChild (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, Gtk.TreeIter parent, int n);

Docs.summary: Sets to be the child of , using the given index. The first index is 0. If is too big, or has no children, is set to an invalid iterator and false is returned. will remain a valid node after this function has been called. As a special case, if is , then the th root node is set.
Docs.returns: a , true if has an th child.
Docs.remarks: This invocation form is closer to the underlying C API, but it's probably less useful for most C# purposes.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool GetIterFromString (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, string path_string);

Docs.summary: Marshals a path string into a object that points to a row in this tree.
Docs.param: a to be set by this method
Docs.returns: A , true if this string is a valid path for this ListStore.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IterChildren (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, Gtk.TreeIter parent);

Docs.param: , an object that will be set to point to the first child.
Docs.returns: A , true if has children.
Docs.remarks: In general, this will return false, as ListStore isn't tree-shaped. However, if is , will return the list itself, since they're all children of the root.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool GetIter (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, Gtk.TreePath path);

Docs.summary: Gets an iterator object for the given .
Docs.param: a to set to point to the row.
Docs.returns: A , true if the row exists

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IterParent (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, Gtk.TreeIter child);

Docs.summary: Gets the parent row of .
Docs.param: a to set to point to the row.
a , the child row whose parent we want to get
Docs.returns: A , true if the parent exists. Since ListStore objects aren't tree-shaped, this will always return false.

Docs.summary: Appends a new row to the ListStore and puts the objects in in it.
Docs.param: a list , one item for each column of a row.
Docs.returns: a pointing to the new row

Docs.summary: Appends a new row to the ListStore and puts the contents of in it.
Docs.param: a with as many elements as the ListStore has columns.
Docs.returns: a pointing to the new row

Docs.summary: Marshals the given into a path string.
Docs.returns: a

MemberSignature.Value: public void MoveAfter (Gtk.TreeIter iter, Gtk.TreeIter position);

Docs.summary: Move the row pointed to by to the position after . If is , will be moved to point to the start of the list.
Docs.remarks: This only works in unsorted stores.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Swap (Gtk.TreeIter a, Gtk.TreeIter b);

Docs.summary: Swaps rows a and b in the store.
Docs.remarks: This is only works in unsorted stores.

MemberSignature.Value: public void MoveBefore (Gtk.TreeIter iter, Gtk.TreeIter position);

Docs.summary: Move the row pointed to by to the position before . If is , will be moved to point to the end of the list.
Docs.remarks: This only works in unsorted stores.

Docs.summary: Test whether is valid for this ListStore.
Docs.returns: a , true if is valid.
Docs.remarks: WARNING: this method is slow and is only intended for debugging/testing purposes.

Docs.summary: Creates a new store. The columns' type specified by the argument.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool GetSortColumnId (out int sort_column_id, out Gtk.SortType order);

Docs.summary: Report on which column is currently being used to sort this ListStore.
Docs.param: a , gets filled with the column number that's currently used for sorting
a , the current type of sort (ascending or descending)
Docs.returns: a , false if the default sort column for this ListStore is being used, true if some other sort column is being used.

Docs.summary: The types in each column of a ListStore.
Docs.remarks: This property is meant primarily for classes that inherit from , and should only be used when constructing a new . It will not function after a row has been added or after a method on the interface has been called.

Docs.summary: Default constructor.
Reorders the ListStore.
Docs.returns: a .
Docs.remarks: (FIXME: Does this binding work?)

Docs.summary: Inserts a new row at position .
Docs.returns: a pointing to the new row.
Docs.remarks: If is larger than the number of rows on the list, then the new row will be appended to the list. The row will be empty before this function is called. To set the value of the new row, use .

Docs.summary: Adds a new row to the beginning of the list.
Docs.returns: a pointing to the new row.
Docs.remarks: The row will be empty before this function is called. To set the value of the new row, use .

Docs.summary: Inserts a new row before . If is null, then the row will be appended to the end of the list.
Docs.param: a , the row to insert before
Docs.returns: a that points to the new row
Docs.remarks: The row will be empty before this function is called. To set the value of the new row, use .

Docs.summary: Inserts a new row after . If is null, then the row will be appended to the end of the list.
Docs.param: a , the row to insert before
Docs.returns: a that points to the new row
Docs.remarks: The row will be empty before this function is called. To set the value of the new row, use .

Docs.summary: Appends a new row to the ListStore.
Docs.returns: a that points to the new row.
Docs.remarks: The row will be empty before this function is called. To set the value of the new row, use .

MemberSignature.Value: public int EmitRowsReordered (Gtk.TreePath path, Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Fires a event.
Docs.param: a , pointer to the row whose children have been reordered
a , pointer to the row whose children have been reordered
Docs.returns: a
Docs.remarks: This is part of the implementation of . It should be called by other class methods that reorder rows so that the proper events are raised. (FIXME: since lists don't have parents/children, how does this get used in practice? There should be an example here.)

Docs.summary: Removes a row from the store.
Docs.returns: a
Docs.remarks: After being removed, is set to be the next valid row, or invalidated if it pointed to the last row in the store.
